Based on your request for a lesson on the topic of "Derivation" in 12th grade Calculus, here are some resources and activities that you can consider:

1. Resource: Textbook Chapter on Derivatives
   - Use your calculus textbook to review the chapter on derivatives. It should provide explanations, examples, and practice problems for your students.

2. Activity: Calculus Spoons Game
   - Play the Calculus Spoons game with your students to reinforce their understanding of derivatives. To play this game, you'll need a set of index cards with functions written on them. Students will pass the cards around, trying to collect a set of four functions that have equivalent derivatives.

3. Resource: Online Video Tutorial on Derivatives
   - Search on YouTube for a video tutorial on derivatives. There are many educational channels that offer concise and easy-to-understand explanations of calculus topics. You can search for "Calculus derivatives tutorial" to find relevant videos.

4. Activity: Derivative Graphing Challenge
   - Challenge your students to graph the derivatives of different functions. Provide a set of functions and have students graph their derivative functions on a coordinate plane. This activity will help them visualize the relationship between functions and their derivatives.

5. Resource: Khan Academy Derivatives Practice
   - Assign practice exercises from Khan Academy's Calculus section. They offer a variety of practice problems and interactive quizzes on derivatives. Direct your students to the website and ask them to complete a set of exercises as part of their homework.

Remember, these are just suggestions to get you started. Feel free to tailor or modify these resources and activities to suit your lesson objectives and teaching style.
